thread.title: Confused About Fees to Your Broker? A New Proposal Could Clear Things Up
thread.title_full: Confused About Fees to Your Broker? A New Proposal Could Clear Things Up

title: Confused About Fees to Your Broker? A New Proposal Could Clear Things Up
text:
Confused About Fees to Your Broker? A New Proposal Could Clear Things Up Written by: Susan Antilla 09/28/15 - 1:30 PM EDT 
SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico (MainStreet) -- Investors may begin to get a clearer accounting of the fees that they pay their brokers -- if their securities firms choose to sign on to a new, voluntary proposal. 
At the annual meeting of the North American Securities Administrators Association (NASAA) here on Sunday, a working group of regulators and industry representatives unveiled a model document for brokers to use to explain the fees they charge for everything from wire transfers to IRA maintenance fees and legal transfer fees. 
Investors would be better able to understand the charges they pay and to compare one firm's fees to another's in a standardized format, according to NASAA officials. More Headlines
